intro: Homalium sorsogonense, commonly known as the Sorsogon Province hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
